definition: to hollow out/to empty out/to use up/(finance) tunneling

sentences.english: He emptied his pockets out,and we knew that he had no money.
sentences.chinese: 他把他口袋掏空，我们知道他没有钱。

sentences.english: Wine and wenches empty men's purses.
We should also avoid further gutting the government's revenues with more tax cuts.
sentences.chinese: 美国也不该继续减税，以免进一步掏空国家税收。

sentences.english: But was pulls out empties entire heart to love your actinium.
sentences.chinese: 而是掏空了整个心在爱你锕。

sentences.english: Ep739 - Amy teams up with Mingming. They plan to clean out all the capital of Shijie Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 爱眉与明明合谋，计划掏空世界饭店的现金。

sentences.english: The oceans are being emptied of fish.
sentences.chinese: 海洋的渔业资源正在被掏空。

sentences.english: With a sampled heartbeat & a stolen soul.
sentences.chinese: 若有似无的心跳，被掏空的灵魂。

sentences.english: His car was stolen , then eviscerated by the thieves.
sentences.chinese: 他的车子被小偷偷了，然后掏空了。

sentences.english: Wine and wenches empty men's purse.
sentences.chinese: 酒和女人能把男人的钱袋掏空。

sentences.english: So the brothers emptied the center of the tree and made a big hole.
sentences.chinese: 兄弟俩把树心掏空，掏成一个很大的树洞。

sentences.english: Bodies with the skins ripped off. The hearts torn from the cadavers .
sentences.chinese: 遇害者奄奄一息，尸体被剥掉皮肤，掏空心脏。

definition: to stuff full/to cram in/packed tight/chock full
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
to exhaust/to use up/to deplete/to drain
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to be dead/not to be, or cease to exist
